perturbation.original_text: Company shall be obliged to pay, within thirty (30) days after receipt of Consultant's final statement, all amounts owing to Consultant for unpaid Services completed by Consultant and related expenses, if any, in accordance with the provisions of Section 1 hereof, and Sections 2, 3, S(c), 6, 7, 8 and 10 shall survive termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Company shall be obliged to pay, within sixty (60) days after receipt of Consultant's final statement, all amounts owing to Consultant for unpaid Services completed by Consultant and related expenses, if any, in accordance with the provisions of Section 1 hereof, and Sections 2, 3, S(c), 6, 7, 8 and 10 shall survive termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the payment deadline from 'thirty (30) days' to 'sixty (60) days.' This conflicts with any other clauses within the contract (or potentially incorporated documents) that might specify a different payment timeframe, creating ambiguity and potential disputes over when payment is actually due.

perturbation.original_text: Consultants shall be given written notice of any adjustments to compensation at least fourteen (14) days prior to adjustments becoming effective.
perturbation.changed_text: Consultants shall be given written notice of any adjustments to compensation at least seven (7) days prior to adjustments becoming effective.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the written notice of adjustments to compensation from 'fourteen (14) days' to 'seven (7) days.' This conflicts with any other clauses within the contract (or potentially incorporated documents) that might specify a different timeframe, creating ambiguity and potential disputes over the expected notice period.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to written waivers that may be provided by the Company upon request, which shall not be unreasonably withheld, Consultant agrees that, during the term of this Agreement, Consultant will not directly or indirectly (i) participate in the formation of any business or commercial entity in the Field of Interest or otherwise competitive with the Company.
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to written waivers that may be provided by the Company upon request, which may be withheld at the company's discretion, Consultant agrees that, during the term of this Agreement, Consultant will not directly or indirectly (i) participate in the formation of any business or commercial entity in the Field of Interest or otherwise competitive with the Company.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'which shall not be unreasonably withheld' to 'which may be withheld at the company's discretion,' a contradiction is introduced. The original text implies a good-faith requirement for waiving the non-compete, while the changed text gives the Company unfettered discretion. This creates uncertainty regarding the consultant's ability to engage in potentially competitive activities.
